name: Curved Clamp
description: A surgical clamp with curved jaws, available in various sizes and serrations (e.g., transverse, longitudinal, or a combination). The curvature facilitates access and visualization in specific surgical fields
uses: Primarily used for clamping blood vessels to control bleeding (hemostasis). Can also be used to hold tissues or secure sutures. Specific sizes and types are chosen based on the vessel or tissue being clamped

imageCitation: Wexler Surgical. (n.d.). Straight Clamp. Retrieved March 9, 2025, from https://www.wexlersurgical.com/images//webp/FL0840_12_TN_01.webp
name: Straight Clamp
description: A surgical clamp with straight jaws, also available in various sizes and serrations
uses: Similar to curved clamps, they are used for clamping blood vessels and tissues, but the straight jaws may be more suitable for certain approaches or when dealing with less deep structures
other_names: Straight Forceps, Straight Hemostat, Kelly Clamp (if larger), Crile Clamp (if medium-sized)

imageCitation: TJM Enterprises. (n.d.). Allis Tissue Forceps. Retrieved March 9, 2025, from https://tjmenterprises.online/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/Allis-Tissue-Forcep.jpg
name: Allis Tissue Forceps
description: A forceps with multiple small, interlocking teeth at the tips. These teeth are designed to grasp tissue gently but firmly
uses:
Used for grasping and holding tissues, particularly slippery or delicate tissues like fascia, bowel, or lung tissue, during dissection or suturing.
They are designed to minimize tissue trauma

imageCitation: Wexler Surgical. (n.d.). Army-Navy Retractor. Retrieved March 9, 2025, from https://www.wexlersurgical.com/images//webp/TL0059_2_TN_01_NEW.webp
name: Army-Navy Retractor
description: A double-ended retractor with smooth, flat blades at each end. The blades are usually slightly curved and angled
uses: Used to retract skin and superficial tissues to improve visualization of the surgical field. Commonly used in shallow or superficial incisions
other_names: U.S. Retractor (less common), Parker Retractor (less common)

name: Thumb Forceps
description: Tweezer-like forceps with serrated tips. They are held between the thumb and forefinger
uses: Used for grasping and manipulating tissues, dressings, or other materials. Not typically used for heavy tissue dissection.
other_names: Dressing Forceps, Thumb Tweezers, Smooth Forceps (if without teeth)

imageCitation: Swell Store. (n.d.). Tissue Forceps. Retrieved March 9, 2025, from https://cdn.swell.store/sklar-staging/6709b001403a7e0012ab2a66/68d34b177b63af531fc518a97879ff87
name: Tissue Forceps
description: Forceps with teeth at the tips. The teeth interlock to provide a secure grip on tissue
uses: Used for holding and manipulating tissue during dissection and suturing. The teeth provide a more secure grip than thumb forceps, but they can also cause more tissue trauma if not used carefully

imageCitation: Wexler Surgical. (n.d.). Adson Forceps. Retrieved March 9, 2025, from https://www.wexlersurgical.com/images//webp/FL0051_1_TN.webp
name: Adson Forceps
description: Small, delicate forceps with narrow tips and fine teeth (or sometimes smooth)
uses: Used for holding fine tissues during delicate procedures, such as plastic surgery, neurosurgery, or vascular surgery
other_names: Adson Dressing Forceps (if smooth), Adson Tissue Forceps (if toothed)

imageCitation: Wilcare. (n.d.). Metzenbaum Scissors. Retrieved March 9, 2025, from https://wilcare.com.ph/cdn/shop/products/Metz-Scissors-Str_680bee1e-1997-4f1e-a1ed-b8558c03f448_720x.jpg?v=1565134323
name: Metzenbaum Scissors
description: Delicate scissors with long, thin blades and blunt tips
uses: Designed for dissecting delicate tissues and for blunt dissection. They are not intended for cutting tough tissues or sutures

imageCitation: Amesco. (n.d.). Mayo Scissors. Retrieved March 9, 2025, from https://amesco.ph/shop/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/Mayo-Surgical-Scissors-Cvd-5.5in-2.jpg
name: Mayo Scissors
description: Heavy-duty surgical scissors with straight or curved blades
uses: Used for cutting tough tissues, such as fascia, muscle, and sutures. Mayo scissors are available in different styles (e.g., Mayo-Dissecting, Mayo-Suture)
other_names: Mayo Dissecting Scissors, Mayo Suture Scissors

name: Blade Holder
description:
A handle designed to hold a surgical blade.
Scalpel handles come in different sizes to accommodate different blade sizes
uses: Used for making incisions and dissecting tissues

imageCitation: Teleflex Surgical. (n.d.). Senn-Miller Retractor. Retrieved March 9, 2025, from https://www.teleflexsurgicalcatalog.com/images/products/pilling/details/SR_480125.jpg
name: Senn-Miller Retractor
description: A double-ended retractor, one end with a smooth blade and the other with multiple small, sharp teeth (rake)
uses: Used to retract skin and superficial tissues, especially in smaller incisions

imageCitation: Teleflex Surgical. (n.d.). Ochsner Clamp. Retrieved March 9, 2025, from https://www.teleflexsurgicalcatalog.com/images/products/pilling/details/SR_182620.jpg
name: Ochsner Clamp
description: A strong clamp with interlocking teeth at the tips
uses: Used for grasping tough tissues or clamping large blood vessels

imageCitation: Harfins. (n.d.). Towel Clips. Retrieved March 9, 2025, from https://usercontent.one/wp/www.harfins.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/10/Backhaus-Towel-Clamp-768x494.jpg?media=1731870444
name: Towel Clips
description: Clamps with sharp, pointed tips
uses: Used to secure surgical drapes to the patient's skin

name: Laparoscope
description: A thin, rigid or flexible tube with a camera and light source
uses: Used to visualize the inside of the abdomen or other body cavities
other_names: Endoscope (general term), Laparoscopic Telescope, Laparoscopic Camera

name: Trocar
description: A sharp-pointed instrument used to create an entry point into the body cavity for laparoscopic instruments. It is typically used with a cannula (sleeve) that remains in place after the trocar is removed.
uses: Creates access ports for laparoscopic instruments

name: Clip Applicator (Laparoscopic)
description: A device used to apply surgical clips
uses: Used to ligate blood vessels or ducts

imageCitation: Fairmont Medical. (2017, December). Disposable laparoscopic scissors. https://www.fairmontmedical.com.au/wp-content/uploads/2017/12/Disposable-Laparoscopic-Scissors.jpg
name: Surgical Shears (Laparoscopic)
description: Specialized shears designed for laparoscopic use
uses: Used for cutting tissue or sutures during laparoscopic procedures

name: Maryland Dissector
description: A curved, fine-tipped dissecting instrument used in laparoscopic surgery
uses: Used for tissue dissection and manipulation
other_names: Maryland Forceps, Maryland Grasper, Maryland Laparoscopic Grasper

imageCitation: Suction Irrigation Cannula. (n.d.). [Photograph of a suction irrigation cannula]. Retrieved from https://5.imimg.com/data5/ANDROID/Default/2020/12/SQ/RM/HY/2995627/product-jpeg.jpg
name: Suction Irrigation Cannula
description: A cannula that allows for simultaneous suction and irrigation
uses: Used to remove fluids and debris from the surgical field during laparoscopic procedures
other_names: Suction Irrigation Probe, Suction Irrigation Handpiece, Dual Lumen Suction Cannula

name: Babcock Grasper
description:
A laparoscopic grasping instrument with a rounded, circular, fenestrated (with an opening) tip.
This design creates a less traumatic grip on tissue. The fenestration helps to distribute pressure and minimize tissue damage.
uses:
Specifically designed for grasping and holding delicate tissues during laparoscopic procedures.
Ideal for tissues that are easily damaged, such as bowel, blood vessels, or other internal organs. The atraumatic nature of the Babcock grasper makes it preferable when minimizing tissue trauma is crucial.

name: Allis Grasper
description:
Similar in design to the open (traditional) Allis tissue forceps, but adapted for laparoscopic use. It features multiple small, interlocking teeth at the tips.
The laparoscopic version is usually longer and thinner than the open version to allow for manipulation through trocars.
uses:
Used for grasping and holding tissues during laparoscopic surgery.
The teeth provide a more secure grip than a Babcock, but they can also cause more tissue trauma if not used carefully. Often used for grasping fascia, organs, or other tissues that require a firmer hold.
other_names: Allis Forceps (Laparoscopic), Tissue Grasper (Laparoscopic - with teeth).

name: Claw Grasper
description: A laparoscopic grasper with sharp, pointed teeth or claws. The teeth can be arranged in various configurations.
uses: Designed for grasping and holding tougher tissues that require a very strong grip. Often used for manipulating dense tissues or tissues that are difficult to grasp with other instruments. Because of the sharp teeth, claw graspers can cause significant tissue trauma if not used carefully.
other_names: Toothed Grasper (Laparoscopic), Aggressive Grasper, Grasping Forceps (Laparoscopic - with teeth)

name: Hook Scissors (Laparoscopic)
description: Scissors with a hooked blade
uses: Used for cutting sutures or tissues during laparoscopic procedures

name: Monopolar L-Hook (Laparoscopic)
description: An electrosurgical instrument with an L-shaped tip
uses: Used for cutting and coagulating tissue during laparoscopic surgery
other_names: Monopolar hook, L-hook electrode, Retractable L-hook sealer/divider

imageCitation: Avante Health Solutions. (n.d.). Marina Medical Debakey forceps. https://avantehs.com/s/marina-medical-debakey-forceps/2333
name: Debakey Forceps
description: Long, slender, atraumatic forceps designed with fine serrations to minimize tissue damage. Essential for handling delicate structures such as the intestines, blood vessels, and other soft tissues. Their non-crushing design ensures minimal trauma while allowing precise manipulation during the procedure.
uses: Used to gently grasp and retract delicate tissues, such as the bowel and mesentery, without causing injury. Their atraumatic nature makes them ideal for minimizing surgical trauma and preserving tissue integrity.
other_names: Debakey Vascular Forceps, Atraumatic Tissue Forceps, Debakey Atraumatic Forceps, Debakey Pickup Forceps

name: Richardson Retractor
description: A flat, curved blade and an ergonomic handle designed for deep tissue retraction. It is available in single or double-ended versions. Its sturdy design provides reliable exposure while minimizing tissue trauma.
uses: Used to hold back the abdominal wall, intestines, and soft tissues to provide a clear surgical field. It helps surgeons visualize and access deep structures, making it essential for procedures involving the peritoneal cavity, bowel, and other abdominal organs.
other_names: Richardson-Eastman Retractor, Abdominal Retractor, Deep Tissue Retractor

name: Narrow Deaver Retractor
description: A long, thin, and slightly curved blade designed for deep tissue and organ retraction. It is a variation of the standard Deaver Retractor but with a narrower blade.
uses: Used to retract the abdominal wall, intestines, or other soft tissues to improve visualization of deeper structures. It is particularly useful for mobilizing organs, protecting surrounding tissues, and maintaining exposure in smaller or more delicate surgical areas.
other_names: Narrow Blade Deaver Retractor, Ribbon Retractor, Deep Tissue Retractor

name: Wide Deaver Retractor
description: A broad, curved blade designed for deep tissue and organ retraction. It provides strong yet gentle retraction that helps holding back large organs and soft tissues during surgery.
uses: Used to retract the abdominal wall, liver, intestines, and other large structures. It allows surgeons to access deeper areas of the peritoneal cavity while protecting surrounding tissues.
other_names: Large Deaver Retractor, Deaver Retractor, Deep Tissue Retractor

name: Malleable Retractor
description: A flat, flexible surgical instrument that can be bent and shaped. Made of stainless steel, it comes in various widths and lengths, allowing for customized retraction of tissues.
uses: Used to retract soft tissues, organs, or blood vessels. Its flexibility makes it especially useful in protecting delicate structures and adjusting to different anatomical spaces during complex procedures.

name: Needle Holder
description: A ratcheted, scissor-like surgical instrument designed to securely grasp and control suture needles during suturing. It has short, serrated jaws with a central groove for a firm grip on the needle, preventing slippage.
uses: For holding and guiding needles while suturing tissues. They provide stability and control, ensuring precise and secure placement of sutures.
other_names: Needle Driver, Surgical Needle Forceps , Mayo-Hegar Needle Holder

name: Babcock
description: Ring-handled, atraumatic surgical instruments with a ratcheted locking mechanism. They have a slightly curved, fenestrated (open) tip with smooth, rounded edges, designed to gently grasp delicate tissues without causing injury.
uses: Ideal for grasping and holding delicate structures such as intestines, fallopian tubes, and appendix.
other_names: Babcock Tissue Forceps, Babcock Intestinal Forceps

name: Mixter
description: Long, curved, right-angled surgical instruments with a ratcheted locking mechanism and serrated jaws.
uses: Ideal for clamping blood vessels, passing sutures around structures, and dissecting tissues in confined spaces.
other_names: Right Angle Forceps, Mixter Clamp, Right Angle Hemostat

name: Lahey Forceps
description: Ring-handled surgical instruments with a ratcheted locking mechanism and sharp, inward-curving teeth at the tip.
uses: Ideal for grasping and retracting soft tissues, such as the thyroid gland, for better exposure. Their sharp teeth ensure a secure hold, making them useful in procedures that require controlled traction.
other_names: Lahey Traction Forceps, Lahey Thyroid Tenaculum

name: Ovum Forceps
description: Long, ring-handled surgical instruments with a ratcheted locking mechanism and large, oval-shaped, serrated or smooth jaws.
uses: Used for packing and removing gauze from deep cavities. Their large jaws allow for efficient grasping of tissues while minimizing damage.
other_names: Bozeman Forceps, Uterine Forceps, Ring Forceps

name: Pean Forceps
description: Long, ring-handled, hemostatic surgical instruments with a ratcheted locking mechanism and fully serrated jaws. They are designed for strong, non-slip gripping of tissues and blood vessels.
uses: Ideal for clamping large blood vessels, controlling bleeding, and holding onto thick tissues during dissection.

name: Balfour Retractor
description: A self-retaining surgical instrument designed with two lateral blades and a central blade, which can be adjusted to provide optimal exposure of the abdominal cavity. Made of stainless steel, it has a ratcheting mechanism that locks the blades in place, allowing hands-free retraction during surgery.
uses: Used to hold back the abdominal wall and soft tissues, providing a clear view of the surgical site. Its self-retaining design minimizes the need for additional assistants and ensures stable, wide exposure for procedures involving the intestines, peritoneum, and other deep structures.
other_names: Balfour Abdominal Retractor, Self-Retaining Abdominal Retractor, Bladder Retractor

name: Hill-Ferguson Retractor
description: A curved, flat blade and a solid, ergonomic handle. It is designed to provide deep retraction of the anal canal and rectum during anorectal procedures.
uses: Helps retract the anal canal, providing clear visualization and access to hemorrhoidal tissue. It maintains exposure during dissection and ligation of hemorrhoids.

name: Pratt Rectal Speculum
description: Has two hinged blades that can be gently expanded using a screw mechanism. It has a smooth, rounded design to minimize patient discomfort while providing optimal visualization of the rectal canal.
uses: Used for examining the rectum and anal canal. It is used in procedures such as hemorrhoidectomy, rectal biopsy, and diagnosing anal fissures, polyps, or other anorectal conditions. The adjustable blades allow for controlled dilation.

name: Pennington Clamp
description: A ring-handled surgical instrument with a ratcheted locking mechanism and triangular, serrated jaws. The jaws are designed to provide a secure yet gentle grip on tissues, minimizing trauma.
uses: Used to grasp and manipulate hemorrhoidal tissue during excision. Its atraumatic triangular jaws allow for a secure hold on the hemorrhoid while minimizing tissue damage.
other_names: Pennington Forceps, Duval Clamp, Triangle Clamp

name: Crile Clamps
description: A ring-handled, ratcheted surgical instrument with fully serrated jaws designed for hemostasis. They are available in straight or curved variations and come in different sizes. Made of stainless steel, they provide a firm grip on tissues and blood vessels.
uses: Used to control bleeding by clamping small to medium-sized blood vessels during surgeries. They are also used for blunt dissection, tissue manipulation, and holding sutures.

name: Rubber Band Ligator
description: Consists of a cylindrical applicator with a mechanism to release the band and may be operated manually or with suction assistance.
uses: Used for reducing hemorrhoid symptoms, promoting tissue shrinkage, and preventing recurrence with minimal discomfort to the patient.

name: PPH Stapler
description: Consists of a circular stapling head, an anvil, and a handle that activates the stapling and cutting mechanism. The device excises excess mucosal tissue and simultaneously staples the remaining tissue, repositioning the hemorrhoidal cushions while preserving the anal canal’s normal anatomy.
uses: It reduces prolapsed tissue by repositioning it inside the anal canal, restoring normal blood flow and function.
other_names: Circular Hemorrhoidal Stapler, Stapled Hemorrhoidopexy Device

name: Fenestrated Grasper
description: A laparoscopic instrument with ringed, fenestrated (open-window) jaws that provide a secure yet gentle grip on tissues.
uses: Used to grasp and manipulate the appendix or surrounding tissues during dissection.
other_names: Fenestrated Laparoscopic Grasper, Atraumatic Grasper, Laparoscopic Bowel Grasper

name: Adson Dissector Hook
description: A slender, curved or angled instrument with a fine, blunt or sharp tip. It is designed for delicate tissue manipulation.
uses: Helps in lifting or retracting small structures such as nerves, vessels, or dura mater.

name: Hegar Dilators
description: Double-ended, cylindrical metal rods with gradually increasing diameters on each end.
uses: Helps in preparing the cervix for intrauterine procedure.

name: Cusco Vaginal Speculum
description: A self-retaining, double-bladed instrument designed to hold the vaginal walls apart for visualization and access to the cervix. It has a hinged, duckbill-shaped design, allowing for easy insertion and adjustment.
uses: Provides clear visualization of the cervix for cervical dilation. Allows access to the uterine cavity for curettage. Facilitates insertion of uterine instruments like dilators, curettes, or suction cannulas. Stabilizes the vaginal walls for better exposure during the procedure.

name: Auvard Weighted Speculum
description: A self-retaining, single-bladed vaginal retractor with a weighted handle designed to hold the vaginal walls open without manual assistance
uses: Providing hands-free vaginal retraction during procedures. Allowing better visualization of the cervix and vaginal walls in gynecological surgeries. Facilitating access for instruments during uterine procedures.

name: Pratt Dilators
description: Are double-ended, rod-like surgical instruments used for progressive dilation of the cervix. They have gradually increasing diameters on each end, allowing for incremental dilation.
uses: Gradually dilating the cervix to allow access to the uterine cavity. Treating cervical stenosis by stretching a narrowed cervical canal. Facilitating safe passage of surgical instruments into the uterus

name: Hanks Dilators
description: Are double-ended, slightly curved metal instruments used for gradual cervical dilation. They have rounded tips and come in progressively increasing sizes, allowing for controlled expansion of the cervical canal. Unlike Pratt dilators, Hanks dilators feature small circular stops (guards) near the ends to prevent over-insertion and reduce the risk of uterine perforation.
uses: Dilating the cervix gradually to facilitate uterine access. Preventing over-insertion with built-in safety stops. Treating cervical stenosis by widening a narrowed cervical canal.

name: Tenaculum Forceps
description: Are long, slender surgical instruments with sharp, hooked tips designed to grasp and stabilize tissue, particularly the cervix and uterus. They have a locking mechanism (ratchet) to hold tissue securely with minimal effort.
uses: Grasping and stabilizing the cervix during procedures. Providing traction to the uterus in hysterectomy or other gynecologic surgeries. Facilitating cervical dilation by holding the cervix steady.

name: Pozzi Forceps
description: Are long, slender with sharp, single-toothed hooks at the tips, designed to grasp and hold the cervix or uterus during medical procedures.
uses: Grasping and stabilizing the cervix during dilation. Providing traction to the uterus in procedures like hysterectomy or myomectomy. Assisting in cervical dilation by holding the cervix steady.
other_names: Pozzi Tenaculum, Uterine Tenaculum Forceps, Single-Toothed Tenaculum

name: Sims Uterine Curettes
description: Are long, spoon-shaped instruments with a sharp or blunt looped tip, designed for scraping and removing tissue from the uterine lining.
uses: Performing dilation and curettage (D&C) to remove retained tissue or for biopsy. Scraping and collecting endometrial tissue for histopathological examination. Removing abnormal tissue or remnants after miscarriage or abortion.
other_names: Sims Curette, Uterine Curette, Endometrial Curette

imageCitation: Kevorkian-Younge Endocervical Biopsy Curette | MPM Medical Supply. (n.d.). MPM Medical Supply. https://www.mpmmedicalsupply.com/products/kevorkian-younge-curette
name: Kevorkian Endocervical Curette
description: A long, slender instrument with a rectangular, sharp-edged tip, often featuring a basket or serrated design to collect tissue samples.
uses: Performing endocervical curettage (ECC) to collect cells for biopsy. Diagnosing cervical and endometrial abnormalities, including precancerous or cancerous conditions. Sampling tissue in cases of abnormal Pap smears for further evaluation.
other_names: Endocervical Curette, Kevorkian Curette with Basket

name: Sims Uterine Sound
description: A long, slender, graduated metal instrument with a blunt tip, often featuring a slight curve to match the natural contour of the uterus. It is designed for gentle insertion through the cervical canal into the uterine cavity to measure its depth and assess its orientation.
uses: Determines the length of the uterine cavity, aiding in the selection of appropriate instruments and devices. Evaluates the position of the uterus (e.g., anteverted, retroverted), which is critical for planning procedures.

imageCitation: Surtex Instruments.com. (2023, October 30). SURTEX® Lockhart-Mummery Fistula Probe - Blunt Tip. https://surtex-instruments.com/product/lockhart-mummery-fistula-probe/
name: Fistula Probe
description: A long, slender, slightly curved metal instrument with a blunt, rounded tip, sometimes featuring a small eyelet or groove at the end. It is designed to explore, trace, and assess the depth and direction of a fistulous tract.
uses: Identifying and tracing the path of a fistula before surgical excision. Assessing the depth, length, and complexity of a fistula tract.
other_names: Fistula Director, Grooved Probe, Seton Probe

imageCitation: Premium Medical Devices – Designed for Precision, Built for Performance. (2021, April 18). Director, W/ Probe Tip & Tongue - Surgivalley: leading surgical instruments & medical device manufacturer. Surgivalley: Leading Surgical Instruments & Medical Device Manufacturer. https://surgivalley.com/product/director-w-probe-tip-tongue/
name: Director with Probe Tip
description: A thin, metal instrument with a blunt, probe-like tip on one end and a flat, grooved surface on the other. It is designed to guide surgical instruments along a specific path while protecting surrounding tissue. The groove allows for the safe passage of a scalpel or other cutting instruments to ensure a precise incision.
uses: Guiding the incision along fistulous tracts during fistulotomy or fistulectomy. Exploring and identifying the direction of a sinus or fistula before surgical intervention. Preventing accidental tissue damage by directing sharp instruments safely.
other_names: Grooved Director, Probe-Tipped Director, Fistula Probe with Groove

imageCitation: Sklar Surgical Instruments. (n.d.). 90-5602 Sklar® Bumm Uterine Curette - 13-1/2, #14 (30mm), sh. . . Sklar Surigical Equipement. https://www.sklarcorp.com/p/sklar-bumm-uterine-curette/90-5602
name: Curette
description: A long, slender instrument with a looped or spoon-shaped tip, designed for scraping and removing granulation tissue, necrotic debris, and infected material from the fistulous tract. It may have a sharp or blunt edge, depending on the extent of tissue removal required.
uses: Scraping and cleaning the fistulous tract to remove unhealthy tissue. Ensuring complete excision of infected or granulated tissue before wound closure. Preventing recurrence of the fistula by thoroughly debriding the area.

imageCitation: Surtex Instruments.com. (2024c, March 14). SURTEX® Lister Sinus Forcep - Straight Jaws Profile. https://surtex-instruments.com/product/lister-sinus-forcep/
name: Sinus Forceps
description: Are long, slender, curved or straight surgical instruments with a blunt, slightly serrated tip, designed for exploring, grasping, and removing debris or foreign bodies from sinus tracts, abscesses, or deep wounds.
uses: Exploring sinus tracts and fistulae to assess depth and direction. Removing pus, foreign bodies, or necrotic tissue from infected wounds or abscesses.
other_names: Dressing Forceps, Bozeman Forceps, Tilley’s Sinus Forceps

imageCitation: Wexler Surgical. (n.d.-a). Garrett Vascular Dilators | Stainless steel | Surgical Inst. https://www.wexlersurgical.com/garrett-vascular-dilators-125mm-tip-round-handle-stainless-steel-825quot-21cm-p-430.html?type=search-instrument-type
name: Vascular Dilator
description: A stiff, tapered, cylindrical instrument made of plastic or metal, designed to gradually expand the vessel entry site after guidewire placement. It features a smooth, tapered tip to minimize trauma and facilitate the passage of a large-bore catheter.
uses: Enlarging the percutaneous entry site after the guidewire has been placed. Facilitating the insertion of central venous catheters (CVCs), hemodialysis catheters, or introducer sheaths. Reducing vessel trauma by ensuring a controlled and gradual dilation.
other_names: Vessel Dilator, Percutaneous Dilator, Introducer Dilator

imageCitation: Admin. (2023, September 29). Introducer Needle - MediTech Devices. Meditech Devices. https://meditechdevices.com/introducer-needle/
name: Introducer Needle
description: A thin, hollow, beveled-tip needle designed for percutaneous vascular access. It is typically short and sturdy, allowing for precise puncture of veins or arteries.
uses: Puncturing the internal jugular (IJ) vein to establish vascular access. Allowing the insertion of a guidewire for central venous catheter (CVC) placement. Facilitating hemodialysis catheter or introducer sheath placement.
other_names: Percutaneous Needle, Seldinger Needle, Vascular Access Needle

name: Guidewire
description: A thin, flexible, metallic wire with a soft, flexible tip to prevent vessel injury. It is designed to navigate through blood vessels and provide a pathway for the insertion of catheters, dilators, or other medical devices.
uses: Facilitating the insertion of central venous catheters (CVCs), hemodialysis catheters, and introducer sheaths. Used in the Seldinger technique to maintain vascular access while replacing needles with larger devices.
other_names: Seldinger Wire, Vascular Guidewire, Introducer Wire

imageCitation: Bactiguard. (2024, September 5). Central Venous Catheter with infection prevention technology. https://www.bactiguard.com/medical-devices/intensive-care/bip-central-venous-catheter/
name: Central Venous Catheter
description: A long, flexible, sterile tube that is inserted into a large central vein, such as the internal jugular (IJ), subclavian, or femoral vein. It is available in single, double, triple, or multiple lumens, allowing simultaneous administration of medications, fluids, and blood products.
uses: Administering medications, fluids, and total parenteral nutrition (TPN). Facilitating central venous pressure (CVP) monitoring in intensive care settings. Providing long-term vascular access for chemotherapy or dialysis. Performing rapid fluid resuscitation in emergency and surgical settings. Enabling blood sampling without repeated peripheral venipunctures.
other_names: Central Line, Central Venous Access Catheter, Central Venous Cannula

name: Ring Curette
description:
A surgical instrument with a circular or oval-shaped blade with a sharp edge.
Ring curettes come in various sizes and angles.
uses: Used for scraping or removing tissue, particularly within bony cavities or lesions.

imageCitation: ARO Surgical. (n.d.). Volkmann bone curette, oblong cup 7mm. https://www.arosurgical.com/volkmann-bone-curette-oblong-cup-7mm/
name: Sharp Spoon Curette
description: A surgical instrument with a spoon-shaped blade with a sharp edge. Sharp spoon curettes are available in different sizes and curvatures.
uses: Used for scraping or removing tissue, often in tighter or more delicate spaces than a ring curette.

name: Doyen Intestinal Clamp
description: A lightweight, non-crushing clamp with long, smooth or finely serrated jaws designed to temporarily occlude the intestines without damaging tissue.
uses: Used in bowel surgeries, such as resections, to gently hold and isolate intestinal segments while preventing leakage of contents.

imageCitation: PAYR INTESTINAL/PYLORUS CLAMP 146MM LONG SERR with O PIN 12.5" 318MM - Surgical Instruments. (2016, October 4). Saharan Surgical. https://surgical.saharan.co.uk/product/payr-intestinalpylorus-clamp-146mm-long-serr-with-o-pin-12-5-318mm/
name: Payr Pylorus Clamp
description: A robust, crushing clamp with strong serrations, designed to occlude the pylorus during gastric surgeries.
uses: Used in gastric resections, such as partial gastrectomy, to control the pyloric region before stapling or suturing.
other_names: Payr’s Crushing Clamp or simply Payr Clamp.

name: Mayo Robson Intestinal Forceps
description: A non-crushing intestinal clamp with broad, slightly curved jaws for atraumatic tissue handling.
uses: Used in gastrointestinal surgeries to handle and temporarily occlude the intestines during anastomoses.

imageCitation: MIRUS Skin Staplers: Surgical skin staplers | Meril Life. (n.d.). Meril Life. https://www.merillife.com/medical-devices/endosurgery/endo-mechancial-staplers/open-surgery/mirus-skin-stapler
name: Surgical Staplers
description: Mechanical devices used to place rows of surgical staples for tissue approximation. Available in linear, circular, and skin stapler variations.
uses: Used in various surgeries, including gastrointestinal, thoracic, and skin closure, to create secure, rapid closures.
other_names: Skin Stapler, Linear Stapler, Circular Stapler

imageCitation: GermedUSA. (n.d.). DeBakey bulldog clamps, straight. [Website link].
name: Bulldog Clamp
description: Mechanical device used to temporarily occlude blood flow in vessels during surgical procedures. Available in various sizes and strengths.
uses: Used in vascular and other surgeries to provide a bloodless field, allowing for precise dissection and repair.
other_names: DeBakey Bulldog Clamp, Serrefine, Vascular Clamp, Bulldog Forceps

name: Yankauer Suction Tip
description: A rigid, curved suction tip with a bulbous head and side holes for controlled fluid suctioning.
uses: Used in general surgeries and oral procedures for clearing blood, fluids, or secretions from the operative field.

imageCitation: Surtex Instruments.com. (2024a, February 27). SURTEX® Poole Suction Tube - Straight & Curved Shank. https://surtex-instruments.com/product/poole-suction-tube/
name: Poole Suction Tip

uses: This mouth gag is primarily used in tonsillectomy, adenoidectomy, and other oropharyngeal surgeries to maintain mouth opening, improve visibility, and facilitate safe access to the surgical site. The plates help protect the lips and prevent pressure injuries.
other_names: Boyle-Davis mouth gag, Tonsillectomy mouth gag, Boyle’s mouth gag.

name: Cobb Curette

uses: It is designed for scraping and removing soft tissue or bone, particularly in spinal surgeries such as laminectomy.

name: Penrose Drain
description: The Penrose drain is a soft, flexible rubber tube used for passive drainage of fluids from a surgical site or wound.
uses: It helps prevent fluid buildup and promotes healing by allowing fluids to escape through capillary action. It is commonly used in abdominal, thoracic, and orthopedic surgeries.

It also has a tool that uses an electric current to cut, remove, or destroy tissue and control bleeding. In men, a resectoscope is inserted through the urethra into the bladder or prostate.
uses: A resectoscope is a medical instrument used to remove tissue, examine organs, and control bleeding. It's a thin, tube-like device with a light, lens, and an electric tool.

name: Langenbeck Retractor
description: The Langenbeck retractor is a handheld surgical instrument used to retract tissues and organs during surgery. It has a flat, curved blade with a sharp or smooth edge that allows the surgeon to hold back tissues to improve visibility and access to the surgical area. The retractor is typically used for deep tissue retraction and is available in various sizes to suit different surgical needs.
uses: The Langenbeck retractor is commonly indicated for use in procedures that require access to deep structures, such as abdominal and pelvic surgeries. It is particularly useful in bladder surgeries, abdominal surgeries, and gastrointestinal procedures, where it helps to hold back the abdominal wall, peritoneum, or other tissues to provide clear visibility and access to underlying structures during dissection or removal.
other_names: Langenbeck's Hook, Langenbeck's Tissue Retractor, Langenbeck Abdominal Retractor

imageCitation: Teleflex Incorporated - Surgical Catalog. (n.d). Hand-Held Retractors: Harrington Retractor. https://www.teleflexsurgicalcatalog.com/pilling/product/482370-harrington-retractor
name: Harrington Retractor
description: Harrington Retractors are essential instruments in abdominal surgeries. Also referred to as "sweetheart" retractors due to their unique heart-shaped blades, they are designed to provide optimal exposure of deep tissues and organs. Named after Dr. Paul Harrington, these retractors offer precision and minimal tissue disruption.
uses: Harrington retractors are used in several types of procedures: in abdominal surgeries, they help hold back tissues and organs to provide clear access to the surgical site, making them indispensable in liver surgery, intestinal surgery, and other deep abdominal operations; for liver retraction, the heart-shaped blade is particularly effective in lifting and holding the liver, reducing the risk of trauma and allowing surgeons to work efficiently on underlying structures; and in general surgery, they are versatile enough to be used in various procedures that require deep tissue retraction and exposure.

imageCitation: CZMEDITECH. (n.d.). Multi-functional bone drill. CZMEDITECH. Retrieved March 13, 2025, from https://www.czmeditech.com/fil/Multi-functional-Bone-Drill-pd44502450.html
name: Bone Drill Set
description: Bone Drills are tools used to bore holes into bone, allowing for the placement of screws or other fixation devices during surgical procedures. They come in various designs, including manual hand drills and powered drills, and are often made of stainless steel.
uses: A tool employed to bore holes into bone, allowing for the placement of screws or other fixation devices during surgical procedures.

imageCitation: Orthopromed Inc. (n.d.). Bone taps. Orthopromed Inc. Retrieved March 13, 2025, from https://www.orthopromed.com/product/bone-taps/
name: Bone Taps
description: Bone Taps are surgical instruments resembling screws with spiral flutes and a handle or shank. They are designed to create threads in pre-drilled bone holes, facilitating the insertion of bone screws during orthopedic procedures.
uses: Utilized to create threads within pre-drilled bone holes, facilitating the insertion of bone screws during orthopedic surgeries.

imageCitation: IndoSurgicals. (n.d.). Plate bender small (pair). IndoSurgicals. Retrieved March 13, 2025, from https://www.indosurgicals.com/orthopedic-instruments/orthopedic-plate-bender/35467-orthopedic-plate-bender-small-pair.php

They typically consist of a handle and curved, adjustable jaws that can be opened and closed to grip and bend the plates.
uses: A specialized instrument designed to shape and contour orthopedic plates, ensuring they conform to the anatomical structure of a patient's bone for effective stabilization and fixation during surgery.
other_names: Bone Plate Bender, Plate Bending Pliers, Plate Bending Irons

imageCitation: MPM Medical Supply. (n.d.). Doyen abdominal retractor. https://www.mpmmedicalsupply.com/products/doyen-abdominal-retractor?srsltid=AfmBOooNhRWFd5cjYMLwXEfC0m-3FtI0Dm5S6RQxNsijd_Q1Zdnwblxb
name: Doyen Abdominal Retractor
description: Is a handheld surgical instrument designed for retracting the abdominal wall during abdominal surgeries. It has a curved, flat blade with a gentle, smooth surface that helps to hold back tissues without causing damage. The retractor is typically used for deep retraction and is often employed when the surgeon needs to provide optimal exposure of internal structures during the operation.
uses: Primarily indicated for use in abdominal surgeries, particularly when a broad, controlled retraction of the abdominal wall is needed. It is commonly used in gastrointestinal surgeries, bladder surgeries, and pelvic surgeries to provide access to deeper abdominal structures, facilitate clear visualization, and improve the surgeon's ability to operate efficiently in the deeper or more confined areas of the abdominal cavity.

name: Sternotomy Saw
description: A Sternotomy Saw is a powered surgical instrument used to cut through the sternum (breastbone) during open-heart surgery, primarily for procedures like coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG).
uses: Specifically used to perform a median sternotomy, which is the surgical splitting of the sternum (breastbone) lengthwise. Creates a wide opening in the chest cavity, providing surgeons with direct access to the heart and other mediastinal structures. Essential for open-heart procedures such as coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG), valve replacements, and heart transplants.

imageCitation: ResearchGate (n.d.). Photograph of a mast-mounted heart-lung machine. https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Dale_Lawson/publication/303725965/figure/fig4/AS:690725616369669@1541693228997/Photograph-of-a-mast-mounted-heart-lung-machine-Courtesy-of-Sorin-Group-Mirandola.jpg
name: Cardiopulmonary Bypass (CPB) Machine
description: The Cardiopulmonary Bypass (CPB) Machine is a medical device that temporarily takes over the function of the heart and lungs during cardiac surgery. It diverts blood away from the heart and lungs, oxygenates it, and returns it to the patient's circulatory system, allowing surgeons to operate on a still, bloodless heart.
uses: Temporarily diverts blood away from the heart and lungs, allowing surgeons to operate on a still, bloodless heart. Oxygenates the blood and removes carbon dioxide, mimicking the function of the lungs. Maintains blood circulation and perfusion to vital organs during complex cardiac surgeries. Allows surgeons to operate on a dry and still surgical field.

name: Aortic and Venous Cannulas
description: Aortic and Venous Cannulas are tubes inserted into the aorta and vena cava, respectively, during cardiopulmonary bypass (CPB). They serve as conduits for diverting blood from the patient's circulatory system to the CPB machine and returning oxygenated blood back to the patient.
uses: Aortic cannula: Inserted into the ascending aorta to deliver oxygenated blood from the CPB machine back into the systemic circulation. Venous cannula: Inserted into the vena cava (superior and/or inferior) to drain deoxygenated blood from the body into the CPB machine. These cannulas establish the connection between the patient's circulatory system and the CPB circuit.

imageCitation: Getinge (n.d.). Vasoview Hemopro 2 Endoscopic Vessel Harvesting System. https://www.getinge.com/siteassets/start/product-catalog/vasoview-hemopro-2-endoscopic-vessel-harvesting-system/vasoview-hemopro-2-endoscopic-vessel-harvesting-system-1280x1280-1.jpg/constrain-0x640-737103746.jpg
name: Endoscopic Vessel Harvesting System
description: An Endoscopic Vessel Harvesting System is a minimally invasive surgical tool used to remove blood vessels (typically veins from the leg or arteries from the arm) for use as grafts in coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG). It employs a small incision and a camera-equipped scope to visualize and dissect the vessel, minimizing tissue trauma.
uses: Minimally invasive removal of saphenous veins from the leg or radial arteries from the arm. Reduces incision size, scarring, and postoperative pain compared to traditional open vessel harvesting. Improves patient recovery and reduces the risk of wound complications. Used to aquire vessels for coronary artery bypass grafting.
other_names: EVH System, Minimally Invasive Vessel Harvesting System

imageCitation: SIS Supplies (n.d.). Cardiovascular and thoracic equipment. https://sissupplies.com/images/medical/store-images/cardiovascular%20and%20thoracic/401921887312.jpeg
name: Coronary Artery Scissors
description: Coronary Artery Scissors are specialized, very fine scissors designed for precise cutting of coronary arteries during cardiac surgery, particularly during anastomosis in CABG procedures. They are crucial for creating accurate and clean vessel openings.
uses: Precise cutting of coronary arteries during anastomosis in CABG procedures. Creating accurate and clean vessel openings for graft placement. Trimming and shaping coronary arteries to ensure proper blood flow.

name: Coronary Artery Dilators
description: Coronary Artery Dilators are slender, tapered instruments used to gently widen narrowed coronary arteries during cardiac surgery. They help improve blood flow and facilitate the placement of grafts or other devices.
uses: Gently widening narrowed coronary arteries to improve blood flow. Facilitating the placement of grafts or other devices during cardiac surgery. Used to verify patency of coronary vessels.

name: Coronary Shunt
description: A Coronary Shunt is a small tube temporarily inserted into a coronary artery during cardiac surgery to maintain blood flow to the heart muscle while the artery is being worked on. They prevent ischemia and protect the myocardium.
uses: Temporarily maintains blood flow to the heart muscle during coronary artery procedures. Prevents ischemia (lack of blood flow) and protects the myocardium (heart muscle). Provides a bloodless field for the surgeon to work.

name: Vessel Clips
description: Vessel Clips are small, metal or polymer clips used to occlude blood vessels during surgery, preventing blood loss. They are applied with a clip applier and provide a secure closure.
uses: Occluding blood vessels to prevent blood loss during surgery. Ligating (tying off) small blood vessels. Marking or identifying specific vessels.

imageCitation: Anika (n.d.). 5-20164 PTS Passer w/ Needle Loaded. https://anika.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/01/5-20164-PTS-Passer-w-needle-loaded_croped.jpg
name: Suture Passer
description: Suture Passer is an instrument designed to facilitate the placement of sutures in hard-to-reach or deep tissues. It helps guide the suture needle through tissue, simplifying complex suturing tasks.
uses: Facilitating the placement of sutures in deep or difficult-to-reach tissues. Simplifying complex suturing tasks. Used in minimaly invasive procedures.

name: Frazier Suction Tip
description: The Frazier Suction Tip is a thin, angled suction tip used for precise suctioning in delicate surgical areas. It's often used in neurosurgery, ENT surgery, and other procedures requiring fine suction control.
uses: Precise suctioning in delicate surgical areas, such as neurological or ENT procedures. Removing small amounts of fluid or debris from confined spaces. Used when working around delicate nerves.

name: Gerald Forceps
description: Gerald Forceps are delicate tissue forceps used for grasping and manipulating fine tissues during surgical procedures. They are often used in vascular and plastic surgery due to their precise handling capabilities.
uses: Grasping and manipulating fine tissues during surgical procedures. Used in vascular and plastic surgery for precise tissue handling. Used when atraumatic tissue manipulation is required.

name: Potts Scissors
description: Potts Scissors are specialized scissors used for extending arteriotomies or venotomies during vascular surgery. They have angled blades that allow for precise cutting of blood vessels.
uses: Extending arteriotomies or venotomies during vascular surgery. Creating precise incisions in blood vessels. Used for delicate vascular work.

name: Sternal Retractors
description: A Sternal Retractor is a surgical instrument designed to separate the sternum (breastbone) after it has been divided during a median sternotomy, a common procedure in open-heart surgery. It provides surgeons with a clear and stable view of the thoracic cavity, facilitating access to the heart and other mediastinal structures
uses: To separate the sternum after a median sternotomy, providing access to the heart and mediastinal structures during open-heart surgery. It holds the sternum in a fixed, open position, allowing surgeons to perform procedures such as coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG), valve replacements, and heart transplants. It ensures a stable surgical field and minimizes trauma to surrounding tissues.
other_names: Sternal Spreader, Chest Retractor, Sternum Retractor

name: Thoracoscopic Retractor
description: A Thoracoscopic Retractor is a specialized instrument used in video-assisted thoracoscopic surgery (VATS) to hold tissues and organs out of the way, providing a clear view of the surgical field through small incisions.
uses: Holding tissues and organs out of the way during VATS procedures. Providing a clear view of the surgical field through small incisions. Increasing the working space inside the thoracic cavity.

name: Internal Mammary Artery Retractor
description: An Internal Mammary Artery Retractor is a specialized retractor used during CABG to hold the internal mammary artery (IMA) in place while it is being harvested for use as a bypass graft. It ensures precise and atraumatic dissection.
uses: Holding the IMA in place during harvesting for CABG. Ensuring precise and atraumatic dissection of the IMA. Provides a stable surgical field while harvesting the IMA.

name: Sauerbruch Rib Shears
description: Sauerbruch Rib Shears are heavy-duty surgical scissors used to cut ribs during thoracotomy procedures. They provide a clean and efficient cut through the rib bone.
uses: Cutting ribs during thoracotomy procedures. Providing a clean and efficient cut through the rib bone. Used to gain access to the thoracic cavity.

name: Doyen Rib Raspatory
description: A Doyen Rib Raspatory is a surgical instrument used to remove periosteum (the membrane covering bone) from the rib during thoracotomy. It prepares the rib for cutting or removal.
uses: Removing periosteum from the rib during thoracotomy. Preparing the rib for cutting or removal. Used to minimize trauma to surrounding tissues.

name: Bailey Rib Approximator
description: A Bailey Rib Approximator is a surgical instrument used to bring the ribs back together after a thoracotomy, facilitating closure of the chest wall. It ensures proper alignment and stability.
uses: Bringing the ribs back together after a thoracotomy. Facilitating closure of the chest wall. Ensuring proper alignment and stability of the rib cage.

name: Hohmann Retractor
description: The Hohmann Retractor features a smooth handle that flares into a flat, broad blade, which then narrows before ending in a leaf-shaped tip. This configuration allows for effective engagement with bone while minimizing soft tissue damage.
uses: The Hohmann retractor is a surgical instrument primarily used in orthopedic procedures to retract soft tissues, such as muscles and fascia, thereby exposing underlying bone structures.  Its design facilitates effective retraction while minimizing tissue damage, making it particularly valuable in minimally invasive surgeries.  By providing a clear view of the surgical field, the Hohmann retractor enhances surgical precision and contributes to improved patient outcomes.

imageCitation: Stille AB. (2019, December 19). ORIGINAL STILLE GOUGE - STILLE. Stille Global. https://www.stille.se/product/original-stille-gouge/
name: Stille Gouge
description: A Stille gouge is a surgical instrument, specifically a type of bone chisel, used in neurosurgical and orthopedic procedures for cutting and shaping bone, featuring a narrow handle and a slim neck that widens to a funnel-shaped blade
uses: Stille gouges are designed to gouge, scrape, and scoop bone during surgical procedures.
other_names: Stille gouge is also known as a Stille-type gouge or a chisel

imageCitation: 691.012 | Bone Nibbler Curved Small (D.A) - Hardik International. (2024, October 22). Hardik International. https://hardikinternational.com/product/691-012-bone-nibbler-curved-small-d-a/
name: Bone Nibbler
description: Bone nibblers are surgical instruments used to precisely cut or remove bone tissue during procedures like fracture fixation, joint reconstruction, and osteotomies, with double-action nibblers offering enhanced cutting efficiently.
uses: Bone nibblers are used to trim irregular bone edges, excise bone fragments, and prepare bone surfaces for grafts or implants.

imageCitation: Merit Medical Devices. (2019, December 20). Coaxial Introducer/Dilator Pair - S-MAK5F-15 - Merit OEM. Merit OEM. https://meritoem.com/product/s-mak5f-15/
name: Introducer Dilator
description: It is a rigid, tapered, cylindrical instrument made of plastic or metal, designed to be inserted over a guidewire. It facilitates vessel dilation with minimal trauma and ensures proper placement of large-bore catheters, such as central venous catheters (CVCs) or hemodialysis catheters.
uses: The introducer dilator is used in internal jugular (IJ) catheter insertion to gradually enlarge the vessel entry site, allowing smooth passage of the catheter or sheath introducer.

imageCitation: Henry Schein, Inc. (n.d.). 0702042 Arthrocentesis Instrument - Henry Schein Medical. https://www.henryschein.com/us-en/medical/p/medical-surgical-supplies/surgical-instruments/instrument-arthrocnt-shephrd/1423719
name: Shepard Cannula
description: The Shepard incision irrigating cannula is a specialized surgical instrument designed for precise irrigation during procedures. Typically 30 gauge in size, it features an angled, flattened tip with a blunt end opening located 5.0 mm from the bend to the tip, and has an overall length of 19.0 mm, excluding the hub.  This design facilitates controlled irrigation, making it suitable for delicate surgical applications.
uses: The Shepard incision irrigating cannula is primarily utilized in ophthalmic surgeries for precise irrigation of corneal wounds.  Additionally, a specialized Y-shaped Shepard cannula has been employed in single-needle arthrocentesis procedures to treat temporomandibular joint disorders, offering an alternative to the traditional double-needle technique.
